The graphic user interface is just like their home security system. It shares the same dashboard, so checking my alarm system, front door cam, and my new Ring Car Cam is easy. I hope their future Car Cams would be of higher quality, like 4K and existing customers can trade in for a new, updated version. I highly recommend this product.

title: Both the light and fan stay on even if the power goes off.
text:
This light with built-in fan and rechargeable battery arrived fast and in good condition. I found that the light with built-in fan and rechargeable battery runs quiet and uses relatively little power. Please see pictures. A typical 120 volt house wall outlet fan can use about 50 watts of energy per hour. You could probably run 5 to 10 of these usb light with built-in fan and rechargeable battery on high for the same amount of electricity that 1 house fan would use. The light with built-in fan and rechargeable battery is relatively light weight and portable. I could see people bringing this light with built-in fan and rechargeable battery with them on a trip and easily powering it with a larger portable power bank or a solar generator. Where I live it snows during the winter and sometimes the power goes off. This light with built-in fan and rechargeable battery will stay on when the power goes off because it has a built in rechargeable battery. Please see pictures.

The light with built-in fan and rechargeable battery has two buttons. A fan button and a light button. First press of the fan button is low speed, then press it again for medium speed, then high speed, and one more press for Off. The light control is very similar to the fan control button. First press is on low then next press makes the light go brighter next press brightest and finally a fourth press of the light control button returns the light to power off.

This usb powered fanlight with built-in fan and rechargeable battery could also be useful during power outages. This light with built-in fan and rechargeable battery would be good on a desk if you need just a little bit more light and it would be good if the power goes off. The fan works well and even better if you are closer to it (like at a desk). Probably a good overlanding, camping and also survival or prepper product.

I would definitely buy this usb powered light with built-in fan and rechargeable battery again because it basically matches the seller's description and it was a good deal. This fan grill comes off for cleaning.

Thank you so very much for taking the time to read my review on this product and have a wonderful wonderful day!

title: Design still needs work. OCD beware!
text:
First off, the print is nice. I think the colors and feel of the material are on point. I believe this product will do it’s intended job of preventing scratches. I will have to update this review later with how long it holds. However, it doesn’t fit right and there will be bubbles/wrinkles.

If you have OCD or are otherwise frustrated by things not lining up perfectly, bubbles, etc, this product is not for you. Buy a case, the sticker will never be perfect. It really shows the two tiny specs of something that I tried to remove but couldn’t.

The design still needs some work. While this wasn’t awful to install or necessarily difficult, it still can be frustrating due to the fact that not everything is measured correctly. I followed the instructional video and was SUPER careful to not stretch it or tweak it because I desperately wanted it to line up correctly. The back bottom piece is definitely not cut or measured exact. Too short depth wise between top edge, button hole, and charging port, plus the speaker holes are off. The front was almost perfect except for where it meets the lanyard hole. Top pieces are measured fine.

The corners. Not a single one laid nice. I understand they’re needed for the curve, but every single one I tried every which way. Smoothing it from the center, smoothing it around the inner or outer curve. They all had wrinkles and didn’t line up. I finally gave up trying to reposition them for fear of messing with their adhesion.

I really want to love this product, but it’s just not there yet. 😓 I’ll update after a few weeks of being in my pocket.

**UPDATE** 2023, February 25
The wrinkles have pretty well ironed out after being in my pocket for weeks. Body heat has helped it slowly secure itself. The overlaps are still there, but it looks a lot smoother. The corners have smoothed out for sure. It has not started peeling and seems like it'll be secure for a long time. If you can get the pieces to line up well, give it a bit in your pocket and it'll be great.

title: Requires a subscription, very slow and does not work well with the Echo show
text:
Pros- 1. It's pretty cheap
2. Records videos if you pay for the subscription
3. Good daytime image quality for such an inexpensive camera
4. Easy to arm and disarm, we usually disarm during the day to save battery life. You can also set up zones that won't get triggered like a tree that moves a lot or a roadway.
5. Can be hardwired for power. I have two cameras that are close enough to outlets so I plan on getting long cables to run to them that way I will have extra batteries for the one that requires those.

Cons- 1. The subscription thing is kind of a scam since they say it will work without one but it really won't. All you can do is look at a live view of a camera but it really isn't a live view since it is so slow you are looking into the past. You cannot record video at all, even to a thumb drive like they say.
2. Cameras need to be very close to the house. We have a mesh system so we get great reception but the camera in our garden is like 15 feet from the house and maybe 40 feet from the module and that camera always fails so I will have to move it.
3. Generally the entire system is very slow. Live view is around a 10-20 second wait but again it isn't a live view it is a delayed view of 5-6 seconds prior
4. You won't ever use it with the Echo show screen because that adds an additional lag of another 10 seconds or so. So the 5 second old video that took 10-20 seconds to show up on your phone will now take an additional 10 seconds to show up on the Echo screen. That was a big bummer, I was really hoping to have a usable video monitor.

We initially got this to find out what was eating out of our garden and we did catch it on one video unfortunately that is the camera that always fails so we only have one short video of it. Turns out we have a coyote that eats peppers. I think we'll keep the system until the batteries go bad and then get a real wired one that you can see live images from and not have the frustration of connection and power issues you get with these wireless systems.

title: Everything you need included; even screen
text:
Projector came with everything included: besides a basic remote that mirrors the functions of the buttons on the projector, it came with an HDMI and AV cable and much to my surprise the 100cm 16:9 screen.

My experience with my first couple of uses is favorable:
- Setup was simple: Plug in, turn on; select projection type from Home, adjust connection settings as needed, focus, watch
- the projector had a lens cap, and came with a microfiber cleaning wipe and some Q-tips for dust removal
- the remote didn’t have batteries (2 AAA are needed) and was relatively responsive, I kept pointing it at the screen instead of the projector and it still worked
- connected to iPad and Android via Direct-Wi-Fi (they call it the European way WLAN), meaning use of the device built in Wi-Fi signal - no problem setting it up and using it
- the picture was a little bleached but I didn’t bother to go into settings to change the picture quality
- one thing I noticed was when using too much of the “Keystone” adjustment, the edges loose sharpness - my TIP, try to set it up with as little Keystone as possible,
- the noise of the fan is noticeable but not distracting; a big plus from an earlier generation projector I had.
- the projector did not heat up and there was no cool down period needed as with older projectors (to preserve the bulb)
- the big surprise was the add-on of the screen. It feels very solid, bright white, wrinkle free material with well placed grommets. It also came with small plastic hooks and strips but I would likely use Command Strips (tm) if needed.

All in all a solid little projector and while it states not suited for PowerPoint etc I still was able to give a slide presentation. - Not perfect but great value. A 4/5 from me. —
*MY RATE SCALE*: 5=perfect; 4=minor imperfections; 3=likely wouldn’t buy again; 2= too many problems; 1= shouldn’t be sold or dangerous).
